title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum prices rose to 3,166.40 USD/T on January 19, 2026, marking a 0.82% increase from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 7.59%, and are up 17.67% compared to the same time last year. The price reflects trading on a contract for difference tracking the benchmark market.

title: January 20 SMM Cast Aluminum Alloy Morning Comment
summary: Aluminum prices continued to retreat on January 19, with SMM A00 spot aluminum closing at 23,870 yuan/mt, down 160 yuan/mt. The aluminum alloy 2603 futures contract closed at 22,910 yuan/mt, up slightly by 0.09%. Secondary aluminum alloy producers maintained stable offers amid firm costs, low inventory, and bullish expectations.

title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
summary: Aluminum prices steadied at $3,197.50 a ton on the LME, the highest in more than three years, following an explosive start to 2026. Copper wavered around a record, while tin rose after rallying. Investors are assessing the next moves for metals amid recent volatility.

title: China Aluminum Output Hits Record 45.02M Tons in 2025
summary: China's aluminum production reached a record high of 45.02 million tonnes in 2025, exceeding the government's 45-million-ton cap. This surge highlights ongoing growth amid energy transition efforts. The output milestone underscores China's dominant role in global aluminum supply.

title: Aluminum Hovers Near 3-Year Highs
summary: Aluminum futures hovered above $3,140 per tonne near three-year highs due to supply constraints in China, the world's largest producer, where output hit record levels in 2025 despite a 45-million-ton cap. Efforts to expand capacity in Indonesia face challenges from high energy costs and regulations. Temporary smelter suspensions in Iceland, Mozambique, and Australia have further tightened global supply.

title: Capital Flood Reshapes Aluminum's Price Logic: Between Belief and Doubt
summary: China's electrolytic aluminum capacity reached 44.83 million tons by end-2025, hitting the regulatory ceiling and accounting for over 57% of global capacity, with output at 44.23 million tons. A production cut at Century Aluminum's Iceland smelter triggered global supply shocks and price surges. China's centralized capacity provides strong supply regulation power in the industry.

title: Hydro joins Alumobility to accelerate aluminium adoption in the automotive industry
summary: Hydro has joined Alumobility, a global association focused on advancing lightweight and sustainable aluminum solutions for the automotive sector. The partnership leverages Hydro's expertise in low-carbon production and circular aluminum approaches to help automakers meet sustainability targets and develop lighter, more efficient vehicles.

title: Aluminum Sector 2026: Strategic Plays in a Supply-Constrained World
summary: Alcoa emerges as a key player in 2026's aluminum sector through innovations like ELYSIS™ and ASTRAEA™ technologies that eliminate greenhouse gas emissions from production. The company's 10-year renewable energy deal with NYPA and $60 million smelter modernization investment position it to capitalize on growing demand for low-carbon aluminum.

title: Aluminium's unifying approach to net-zero transformation
summary: The aluminum industry is advancing decarbonization through multiple innovations including ELYSIS zero-carbon smelting technology and CelestiAL solar-powered aluminum production by Emirates Global Aluminium. The sector is implementing a multi-faceted strategy combining clean energy investments with recycling revolution to achieve net-zero goals.

title: Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Steel prices fell to 3097 CNY/T on January 20, 2026, down 0.86% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 0.36%, but remain 6.35% lower than a year ago. On January 19, prices were at 3,117 CNY/T, down 0.67%.

title: HRC Steel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: HRC Steel fell to 937.08 USD/T on January 19, 2026, down 0.20% from the previous day. Over the past month, prices have risen 3.20% and are up 34.83% year-over-year. Data was last updated on January 20, 2026.

title: Steel prices hiked again amid rising exports
summary: Steel prices in India were hiked again on Friday due to safeguard duties, rising exports, and higher input costs. Some mills increased hot-rolled coil (HRC) prices by 500-750 per tonne. HRC serves as a benchmark for flat steel.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Steel producer Nucor kept its hot-rolled coil prices steady in the last week of December 2025, ending nine weeks of consistent price increases. China implemented a steel export licensing framework on January 1, requiring exporters to obtain permission to ship about 300 steel products. Global steel markets face extended lead times of five to six weeks due to demand.

title: Steel Caucus hears unified call for tougher trade enforcement
summary: U.S. Steel highlighted investment momentum with upgrades across multiple facilities and major projects including Big River 2, a new hot strip mill. Industry leaders called for stronger trade laws and melt-and-pour standards to address rising global excess capacity projected to reach 720 million metric tons by 2027.

title: January 2026 Global Steel & Shipping Industry News Roundup
summary: Significant changes in steel tariffs, port fees, and transportation costs are expected in early 2026, particularly affecting international trade between Asia, Mexico, Russia, and Africa. Mexico raised tariffs on Chinese goods up to 50%, and Russia increased port fees by 15%.

title: Global Green Steel Markets Post-CBAM Implementation
summary: 2026 marks the first year when green steel ambitions meet transformed policy environments and market realities following CBAM implementation in Europe. China is advancing green steel production with mills reducing carbon emissions by 30-40% compared to traditional processes, while higher CBAM costs are expected to constrain Chinese steel trade into European markets.

title: Signs Point to a Bright Future for U.S. Green Steel in 2026
summary: U.S. steel manufacturing is advancing with green innovations like lower-carbon electric arc mini-mills that recycle scrap steel, reducing reliance on coal and cutting emissions by 37% per ton since 1990. Startups such as Hertha Metals and Electra are pioneering coal-free processes using electricity and chemical reactions, making production more energy-efficient and cost-competitive than traditional methods or even Chinese production. These developments signal a promising shift toward full decarbonization amid rising investor interest.

title: constructsteel marked the inauguration of a new steel-based Zero Energy Building (ZEB) in Bhubaneswar
summary: The inauguration of a new steel-based Zero Energy Building in Bhubaneswar, developed with Tata Steel, showcases advanced steel construction technologies for efficient, climate-resilient buildings in India. This project highlights steel's role in sustainability. The 2025 constructsteel Awards recognized projects like One Bloor West for innovation and St Marys for sustainability excellence.

title: Innovation and Sustainability Define Top Stainless Steel Manufacturer
summary: Leading stainless steel manufacturers are integrating Industry 4.0 technologies, including AI-driven process optimization, to enhance competitiveness through innovation. Sustainability is a core focus, redefining the industry landscape. This approach combines technological advancements with environmental responsibility.

title: High copper prices persist in early 2026
summary: Copper prices surged nearly 20% to a record US$13,310/t on 12 January 2026, driven by strong fundamentals, trading activity, and financial flows amid geopolitical tensions and macroeconomic uncertainty. Prices are expected to remain volatile but supported above US$13,000/t over the next three months, with upside risks from supply disruptions like labor issues in Chile. Supportive macro conditions, including potential US monetary easing and increased M&A activity, could keep prices elevated longer.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper fell to 5.87 USD/Lbs on January 20, 2026, down 0.39% from the previous day, after rising to 5.90 USD/Lbs on January 19 amid a weaker dollar and mixed Chinese economic signals. Over the past month, prices rose 8.02%, up 36.70% year-over-year, following a historical high of 6.11 in January 2026. Recent declines linked to China's crackdown on high-frequency trading.

title: Commodity Update – January 2026
summary: Copper prices hit a record high to start 2026, opening at $6.01, with 27 price increases for copper wire, driven by strong demand in data centers and renewable energy outpacing supply due to mining disruptions. Backed by China's 2026 growth priority and US stockpiling in late 2025. Analysts foresee short-term volatility from weak China demand but long-term rises toward $7 per pound.

title: BHP Upgrades Copper Output Guidance; Raises Cost of Potash Project (2nd Update)
summary: BHP upgraded its fiscal year copper production guidance to 1.9-2.0 million metric tons, supported by strong performance at Escondida mine amid record-high prices from healthy demand and competitor supply disruptions. U.S. copper futures surged to all-time highs, with BHP noting a 29% jump in realized copper prices quarter-over-quarter. CEO highlights resilient Chinese demand and positive 2026 global growth outlook.

title: Aluminum and copper prices take breather after explosive start to 2026
summary: Copper wavered around its record above $13,000/ton on the LME after a bullish run into 2026, with aluminum steady at three-year highs, as investors assess softening China demand amid elevated geopolitical risks. The rally is underpinned by tight supplies failing to match demand from AI-driven data centers, electronics, and Fed rate cuts. LMEX Index hit highest since March 2022.

title: Latest updates on metals prices worldwide at 0200 GMT, Jan. 20
summary: At 0200 GMT on Jan. 20, 2026, COMEX copper price stood at 5.82 USD, amid latest global metals updates including gold, iron ore, palladium, and platinum. Reflects current spot pricing in ongoing volatile market.

title: Copper prices near all-time high: Structural shift or speculative spike? Here's where the red metal is headed
summary: MCX January 2026 copper futures jumped over 1.3% to Rs 1330.45/kg, nearing lifetime highs, driven by structural supply-demand imbalance outpacing growth and reinforced by geopolitical risks. Prices may oscillate near $13,000/tonne short-term but sustain strength through 2026 per analyst forecasts. Outlook tied to macro policies, mine recovery, and trade rules.

title: In mid-January 2026, LME copper prices retreated from their record
summary: LME copper prices retreated from records in mid-January 2026, with transaction prices ranging 100,380-100,960 yuan/mt, averaging 100,670 yuan/mt, down 910 yuan/mt from prior day. Indicates pullback after earlier surges amid market trends.

title: BHP Boosts Copper Production Outlook for FY26
summary: BHP has increased its fiscal year 2026 copper production guidance to between 1.9 and 2.0 million tonnes, driven by record throughput at the Escondida mine and strong asset performance. The company also reported gains in iron ore and coal production amid rising commodity prices. CEO Mike Henry highlighted strong operating momentum and a pathway to 2 million tonnes of copper production in the 2030s.

title: BHP lifts copper guidance after record half-year output
summary: BHP upgraded its FY26 copper production guidance to 1,900–2,000 kt following record half-year output and strong performance at Escondida. Iron ore and coal production also rose, supported by higher prices including copper up 32%. Management emphasized a significant copper growth pipeline targeting around 2 Mt in the 2030s.

title: BHP Upgrades Copper Output Guidance; Raises Cost of Potash Project (Again) (2nd Update)
summary: BHP Group raised its FY26 copper production guidance to 1.9-2.0 million metric tons, fueled by strong Escondida performance amid record-high copper prices. Second-quarter copper output was 490,500 tons, with first-half production flat year-over-year. Iron ore production increased, though prices face pressure from China negotiations.

title: Chile delays copper output peak, cuts short-term forecasts
summary: Chile, the world's largest copper producer, delayed its peak annual output goal above 6 million tons by several years and cut forecasts for 2026-2031 due to falling ore grades and mining plan adjustments. Production is expected to stabilize at current levels with gradual recovery toward the period's end. The revision was outlined in a Cochilco report.

title: AWS to Source Low Carbon Nuton Copper from Rio Tinto for U.S. Data Center Infrastructure
summary: Amazon Web Services (AWS) is collaborating with Rio Tinto to source low-carbon copper produced via Nuton technology for U.S. data centers. Nuton uses microorganisms to extract copper from sulphide ores, reducing emissions, water use, and the mine-to-market chain compared to traditional methods. This partnership leverages AWS's data analytics to optimize the sustainable copper production process.

title: Rio Tinto and Amazon Web Services collaborate to bring low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centres
summary: Rio Tinto and AWS are partnering to supply low-carbon Nuton copper to U.S. data centers, highlighting innovation in sustainable mining. The Nuton process produces high-purity copper cathode directly at the mine, minimizing environmental impact. This collaboration aims to meet growing demand from cloud computing while advancing decarbonization.

title: US Solar-coaster; Copper in the Age of AI; and 2026 Private Credit Daily Update
summary: A comprehensive study projects global copper demand rising 50% to 42 million metric tons by 2040 due to AI, electrification, and data centers, potentially facing a 10 million ton shortfall without supply innovations. Copper's role in electricity generation, transmission, and tech underscores the need for sustainable production advances. The report highlights supply challenges amid surging technological demand.

title: On January 20, the SMM #1 refined nickel price was ...
summary: On January 20, the SMM #1 refined nickel price ranged from 140,900-151,800 yuan/mt, averaging 146,350 yuan/mt, up 450 yuan/mt from the previous day. This indicates a slight upward movement in Chinese refined nickel pricing amid ongoing market fluctuations.

title: Tariff Noise, Limited Signal
summary: Base metals, including nickel, recovered some of Friday's weakness on January 20, with expectations of transitioning into a rangebound phase in the near term. Dip-buying persisted, reflecting cautious market sentiment amid tariff discussions.

title: Nickel Futures Retreat From Recent Highs
summary: Indonesia cut its 2026 nickel ore production quotas by about 34% compared to last year to align output with processing capacity and conserve high-grade ore. Nickel futures fell toward $18,000 per tonne after hitting a 19-month high, amid profit-taking and softening Chinese demand. Nickel Industries reported lower ore sales in Q4 but resumed shipments in early January.

title: Betting on Western Supply Chains as Indonesia Reduces Production
summary: Canada Nickel's Crawford Project, with the world's second-largest nickel reserves, targets construction start by end-2026 and offers carbon-negative production with first-quartile costs. The project benefits from Indonesia's production cuts, positioning it as a key non-Indonesian/Chinese supply source amid tightening Western battery-grade nickel chains. Exploration upside and metallurgical consistency support potential capacity expansions.

title: Vale Indonesia says 2026 mining quota won’t be enough to meet demand from new smelters
summary: PT Vale Indonesia states its 2026 mining production quota is insufficient for new HPAL smelters in Pomalaa (120,000 tons MHP capacity, needing 21 million tons ore) and Bahodopi (66,000 tons MHP, needing 10.4 million tons ore), both starting in 2026. The company seeks additional quota approvals amid $4.5B and $2B investments. 2025 nickel matte output exceeded targets at 66,848 tons through November.

title: Vale Indonesia appeals nickel quota, says granted volume is too low
summary: PT Vale Indonesia appeals its annual production plan (RKAB) as the current ore quota falls short for three HPAL projects, including Pomalaa requiring 21 million tonnes of limonite ore annually for 120,000-tonne capacity. Mining must start this year to stockpile ore ahead of August 2026 mechanical completion. The appeal addresses supply commitments for major EV battery material production.

title: Global Nickel Market Recalibrates After Explosive Trading Week
summary: Nickel prices stabilized near $17,900/t after surging 10% on Indonesian production curb concerns and Chinese buying, with PT Vale Indonesia halting some mining at 30% capacity pending 2026 quota approvals. LME stocks rose 300% since early 2025 to 275,600 tons, countering tightness. Vale expects quick resolutions without disrupting operations.

title: Critical minerals: Why innovation begins beneath the Earth's surface
summary: The article discusses how achieving net zero by 2050 requires securing escalating supplies of critical minerals including nickel for green technologies. It highlights that demand for critical minerals could be more than 3.4 times current levels by 2040 according to the International Energy Agency, and emphasizes the need for responsible mining practices through collaboration between industry, governments, and civil society.

title: Nickel market set for steady growth as stainless steel and EV demand reshape supply
summary: The article examines nickel market growth driven by stainless steel demand in Asia and battery-grade refining expansion in North America. It highlights strategic shifts toward localized, lower-carbon supply chains and increasing sustainability pressures on mining and refining companies to adopt renewable energy and cleaner production methods.

title: TECH Project high-grade nickel is primed to fuel the global green transition
summary: Queensland Pacific Metals' TECH Project aims to become a leading source of high-grade, ethically derived nickel for EV batteries and green energy. The project features the DNi Process, an environmentally-friendly extraction method with 98% nitric acid recycling and no tailings dam requirements, positioning it as a carbon-negative production facility.

title: Battery Metals: The Strategic Investment Case for 2026
summary: The article analyzes the nickel market's supply-demand imbalance, projecting global nickel demand will double to 5-6 million tonnes by 2030. It highlights Canada Nickel's innovative carbon sequestration strategies and the importance of first-quartile cost projects in securing financing for Western nickel development.

title: Prysmian shares rise as Italian cable maker seen as winner amid US copper tariffs
summary: Prysmian shares rose as much as 4% following US President Donald Trump's announcement of a 50% tariff on imported copper. As the world's largest cable maker with significant US operations, Prysmian is positioned to benefit from its vertically integrated copper production in the US, including its Arizona copper mine sourcing and Texas copper rod mill, allowing it to pass higher prices to customers.

title: BofA Sees Growth Potential for Prysmian from US Tariffs
summary: Bank of America estimates US copper tariffs could generate EUR500 million to EUR1 billion in additional EBITDA for Prysmian in 2026, with potential price increases of 10% on copper cables. Following the Encore Wire acquisition, Prysmian's copper cable production is now almost entirely US-based using locally sourced recycled material, positioning the company to capitalize on tariff-driven competitive advantages.
